questions.text: A 30-year-old P2L2 immediately collapses as soon as the placenta is delivered. Her pulse is not recordable, and her BP is 80/40 mmHg. She is gasping for breath. Immediately CPR is initiated, and amniotic fluid embolism is suspected. Which is NOT a criterion for diagnosis amniotic fluid embolism?

options.label: D
options.text: Onset during labor or within 30 mins of delivery

questions.text: Match the following types of craniosynostosis with the affected sutures:
Which of the following is NOT one of the three clinical diagnostic criteria for bacterial vaginosis described by Amsel?

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

options.label: C
options.text: Clue cells seen on vaginal saline preparation by light microscopy

options.label: D
options.text: Characteristic fishy odour release with addition of potassium hydroxide to vaginal secretions

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

questions.text: The risk of fetal varicella syndrome is maximum when the mother is infected between:

A 33-year-old woman, gravida 2 para 1, comes to the OPD for a prenatal visit at 20 weeks gestation. She feels well and reports experiencing fetal movements. The patient and her husband have no medical conditions, but their first child, a 3-year-old boy, was born with spina bifida. Physical examination is unremarkable, and uterine size is in accordance with dates established using ultrasonography. The patient is worried that the fetus may develop the same birth defect as her first child. The inheritance pattern of her child's birth defect is most similar to which of the following conditions?

options.label: C
options.text: Myoclonic epilepsy with ragged red fibers

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a risk factor for epithelial ovarian cancer?
What should be the best initial feeding method for a baby born at 33 weeks gestation, with no perinatal complications?
What hormones are secreted by the Leydig cells and the Sertoli cells respectively?
Which of the following monoclonal antibodies is NOT correctly paired with its target?

A 28-year-old man is evaluated for abnormal movements of the hands and face. The patient reports that he started experiencing involuntary grimacing a year ago, which has gradually worsened. He is taking a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor for major depression but has not taken any antipsychotic medications. His 52-year-old father was diagnosed with an inherited movement disorder 2 months ago. Physical examination shows normal strength and normal deep tendon reflexes. No sensory deficits are noted. Which of the following best explains the difference in disease presentation between this patient and his father?
What would be your advice for a patient who has undergone a vesicovaginal fistula repair?

options.label: A
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year

options.label: B
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 3 weeks and avoid pregnancy for 6 months

options.label: C
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 6 weeks and avoid pregnancy for a year

options.label: D
options.text: Sexual abstinence for 6 months and avoid pregnancy for 6 years

questions.correct_answer: A. Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Sexual abstinence for 3 months and avoid pregnancy for a year

questions.text: Identify the instrument:

options.label: A
options.text: Herpenden calliper for skin fold thickness

questions.correct_answer: A. Herpenden calliper for skin fold thickness
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Herpenden calliper for skin fold thickness

questions.text: Which one among the following has the lowest risk of perinatal transmission?

A 23-year primi came to the emergency department at 35 weeks of pregnancy with pedal edema and BP of 140/90 mmHg. The urine dipstick was 2+. Her investigations are listed below. Hb – 9.2g%, RBS – 123, SGOT – 250, SGPT- 300, Creatinine-0.7, platelet: 50000. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Corticosteroids followed by induction of labor

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for evaluation of muscle weakness. The patient has a history of seizures. Examination shows decreased strength in the upper and lower extremities on the left compared to the right. Laboratory evaluation shows increased serum lactate levels both after exercise and at rest. His older sister is affected by the same disorder, but she displays very few symptoms. Which of the following is the most likely pedigree chart in the following?
As per the WHO Labor Care Guide, at what cervical dilatation should active phase begin?
Which of the following decreases Down’s syndrome?

A 4-month-old girl is diagnosed with a febrile urinary tract infection. A voiding cystourethrogram is shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this infant's presentation?

options.label: C
options.text: Obstruction due to a renal stone

options.label: D
options.text: Presence of a posterior urethral valve

questions.correct_answer: A. Congenital short intravesical ureter length
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Congenital short intravesical ureter length

questions.text: Which of the following prostaglandins analogue is NOT correctly paired with its clinical use?

A 37-year-old woman comes to the OPD for evaluation of abnormal vaginal discharge. She noticed increased clear, watery vaginal discharge 4 months ago and now has intermenstrual bleeding. She reports no pruritus or dysuria. Blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg and pulse is 88/min. PS examination is shown. The vaginal mucosa is not erythematous and has no lesions. The uterus is small, mobile, and anteverted, with no adnexal masses or cervical motion tenderness. No inguinal lymphadenopathy is present. Which of the following is the best next step in the diagnosis of this patient's condition?

options.label: C
options.text: Nucleic acid amplification testing for gonorrhea and chlamydia

questions.text: Which of the following is commonly associated with this type of pelvis?
A child suffering from steroid-dependent nephrotic syndrome is brought to the OD for vaccination. Which of the following is true about vaccination in this child?

options.label: A
options.text: All live vaccines under NIS can be given as per schedule

options.label: B
options.text: All killed vaccines under NIS can be given

options.label: C
options.text: Only pneumococcal vaccine should be given to the child in acute phase

options.label: D
options.text: Live vaccines are contraindicated in the child's sibling

questions.correct_answer: B. All killed vaccines under NIS can be given
questions.explanation: Ans. B. All killed vaccines under NIS can be given

questions.text: A 24-year woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She is 3 months pregnant. On asking, she tells you that she has a 4-year-old son followed by a twin pregnancy which she terminated at 8 weeks. What is her obstetric formula?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) G3P1A1

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gravida refers to the total number of pregnancies, Para refers to the number of pregnancies that reached viability, and Abortions refers to pregnancies that ended before viability. In this case, the woman is G3P1A1 : three pregnancies, one viable, and one abortion.
  • ➤ Gravida
  • ➤ Para
  • ➤ Abortions
  • ➤ G3P1A1

questions.text: A 23-year-old primigravida has a vaginal delivery. She visits for a postnatal check up on the 10 th postnatal day. At what level will the uterus be palpable on abdominal examination?

options.label: C
options.text: Midway between the umbilicus and the pubic symphysis

questions.correct_answer: D. Just above the pubic symphysis
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Just above the pubic symphysis

questions.text: You are conducting the delivery of a 24-year primigravida. Following crowning, the head is born by?

59-year-old postmenopausal woman comes to the OPD for evaluation of breast tenderness. She has had no breast masses or nipple discharge. The patient has also noticed an increase in her weight, particularly around the abdomen, despite not being able to eat as much. She went through menopause 5 years ago. Breast examination shows bilateral, diffuse fibrocystic changes. The abdomen is distended, and a large right lower quadrant mass is palpable. Pelvic ultrasound reveals a 12-cm complex right ovarian mass with solid components and multiple septations, a slightly enlarged uterus, and a 9-mm endometrial stripe. Which of the following tumor markers is most likely to be elevated in this patient?
Dried blood spot (DBS) testing is commonly done in infants for:
All except which of the following are true regarding vaccinations in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaccines that contain toxoids may be administered during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: The hepatitis B vaccine series may be administered during pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination

options.label: D
options.text: Conception should be delayed by 1 month after receiving the rubella vaccine

questions.correct_answer: C. Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination

questions.text: A 24y P2L2 who does not want more children presents to the OPD as she cannot feel the thread of the Multiload 375 that was inserted 3 years earlier. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks earlier. On examination, the cervix appears normal, and the thread is not seen. A transvaginal scan shows the following image. What is the next best step?

options.label: C
options.text: Remove the IUCD with a hook

questions.text: A 29-year-old G1P0 presents to your hospital at 18 weeks gestation for an ultrasound. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-month-old full-term boy is brought to the clinic for a well-child examination. At age 6 months, he had a generalized seizure that lasted approximately 2 minutes within hours of receiving the diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine. He was taken to the emergency department for observation and discharged later that day. The patient has had no other seizures or medical concerns and takes no medications. His uncle has a history of childhood-onset epilepsy. The child is due for the fourth dose of the diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer the diphtheria and tetanus toxoids; avoid the pertussis component

options.label: B
options.text: Administer the diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine as scheduled

options.label: C
options.text: Administer only the tetanus toxoid at this time

options.label: D
options.text: Hold all immunizations containing diphtheria, tetanus, or pertussis components

questions.correct_answer: B. Administer the diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine as scheduled
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Administer the diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis vaccine as scheduled

questions.text: You are an intern and are conducting delivery of a 24-year G2P1. The head is delivered and undergoes restitution and external rotation. When you attempt to deliver the anterior shoulder, you notice that there are 2 tight loops of cord around the neck. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Try to slip the cords over the fetal head

options.label: C
options.text: Clamp the cord, cut it and unwind it from around the fetal neck

questions.correct_answer: C. Clamp the cord, cut it and unwind it from around the fetal neck
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Clamp the cord, cut it and unwind it from around the fetal neck

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the presence of tight loops of the umbilical cord around the fetal neck during delivery, the correct action is to clamp, cut, and unwind the cord to avoid complications such as fetal blood loss or cord snapping. This allows for a safe delivery to proceed.
  • ➤ tight loops of the umbilical cord
  • ➤ clamp, cut, and unwind

questions.text: An elderly patient presents with cutaneous vasculitis and hemoptysis. HRCT is shown below. Which investigation should be performed next to help you diagnose the condition?
A 8-year-old boy weighing 30 Kgs has been posted for surgical resection of a tumor. What is the daily maintenance fluid required for this child while he's NPO?

A 23-year-old woman presents with vaginal discharge. There is no foul smell or associated pruritis. On examination, there is white discharge and the cervix and vagina are normal. A pH is done which is 4 and a vaginal smear shows the following. What is the following?

A 34-year-old woman is evaluated in the postpartum unit for vaginal bleeding. Two hours ago, she underwent an uncomplicated spontaneous vaginal delivery with an estimated blood loss of 250 mL. Bleeding was initially minimal, but there is now profuse vaginal bleeding, and the patient's perineal pad is soaked with blood and large clots. The patient has chronic hypertension that has been managed throughout this pregnancy with labetalol. Blood pressure is 148/102 mm Hg and pulse is 110/min. On pelvic examination, the uterine fundus is soft. All of the following should be done next except?
What is this maneuver?
You have been called to declare the brain death of a 12-year-old child in the ICU. Which of the following is not seen in brain death?
Considering the components of the APGAR score, which of the following is not a factor included in this assessment tool?

A 30 year P1 with a last menstrual period 10 days ago presents to the emergency with complaints of worsening right pelvic pain. She says that she had sudden onset of sharp pain after bending over to pick up her child. The pain did not respond to acetaminophen and has intermittently worsened during the past several hours. She also had 2 episodes of vomiting. On examination, there is abdominal guarding. Transvaginal sonography demonstrates an 8-cm enlarged right ovary. There is high impedance arterial flow of the ovary on colour Doppler. These findings are most consistent with which of the following clinical diagnoses?

A 39-year-old woman, gravida 2 para 1, at 38 weeks gestation, comes to the office for a routine prenatal visit. The patient feels well and reports normal fetal activity. Last week, she had nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea for 24 hours, but she has been able to eat and drink normally for the past several days. For the past 2 days, the patient has had increased clear vaginal discharge with irregular, painful contractions but no vaginal bleeding. Temperature is 99.6 F (37.6 C), blood pressure is 132/86 mm Hg, and pulse is 96/ min. The uterus is nontender and the fundal height is 34 cm. Fetal heart tones are 135/ min. Fetal ultrasound shows a cephalic fetus, measuring at the 50th percentile for gestational age, and an amniotic fluid index of 2 cm (normal: >5 cm). Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's amniotic fluid level?

A 36-year-old woman, G4P3 presents at 34 weeks gestation for an antenatal visit. She has a history of previous cesarean deliveries. During her routine ultrasound examination, the radiologist reports findings suggestive of placenta accreta. The patient has no symptoms at present. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Expectant management with close monitoring and regular ultrasounds

options.label: D
options.text: Initiation of antenatal corticosteroids and scheduled cesarean section at 37 weeks gestation

questions.correct_answer: C. Preoperative planning for cesarean hysterectomy
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Preoperative planning for cesarean hysterectomy

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Localisation of sound-1month Walk without support - 12months Tower of 2 - 15months Walk upstairs with alternate foot - 4yrs Tricycle – 5yrs

A 13-year-old girl is brought to the office for evaluation of acne. She began to develop acne over her forehead and chin 4 months ago. The girl has grown 10.1 cm in the last year; her height and weight are at the 70th percentile for age. There is no breast bud development. External pelvic examination shows the clitoris protruding from the clitoral hood and bilateral masses in the labia majora. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 29-year-old woman, G2P1 presents at 18 weeks gestation with a history of a previous preterm birth at 28 weeks. She is concerned about the risk of another preterm delivery in the current pregnancy. On examination, her cervix is found to be dilated to 2 cm and effaced. She has no contractions at the time of evaluation. Fetal ultrasound shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most appropriate management for this patient to reduce the risk of preterm birth?

A 31-year-old woman, gravida 3 para 2, at 40 weeks gestation is in active labor. The patient has had a normal prenatal course. Her first pregnancy was an uncomplicated term vaginal delivery. Her second pregnancy ended with an emergent cesarean delivery for a nonreassuring fetal heart rate pattern. Spontaneous rupture of the membranes occurred 15 minutes ago with blood-tinged amniotic fluid. Blood pressure is 124/76 mm Hg, pulse is 78/ min, and respirations are 18/min. On pelvic examination, the cervix is 6 cm dilated and 80% effaced, and the fetal presenting part is at +1 station. The fetal heart rate tracing is shown. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this fetal heart rate pattern?
Which alternative method can be used for the procedure shown in the image below?
Which of the following decreases in pregnancy?

A woman presented to the clinic with heavy, painful menses that have worsened over the past year. On pelvic examination the uterus is enlarged and tender. USG is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a true statement about congenital CMV infection?

options.label: A
options.text: About 20-30% of the infections are symptomatic

options.label: B
options.text: Triad of SNHL, periventricular calcification and enamel hypoplasia

options.label: C
options.text: Most children asymptomatic at birth can develop conductive hearing loss later in life

options.label: D
options.text: If mother is IgG positive for CMV, the child is unlikely to develop infection

questions.correct_answer: D. If mother is IgG positive for CMV, the child is unlikely to develop infection
questions.explanation: Ans. D. If mother is IgG positive for CMV, the child is unlikely to develop infection

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman comes to the OPD for follow-up of breast biopsy that confirmed high-grade malignant features. Family history is significant for ovarian cancer in her mother, who died at age 50. Genetic testing reveals a mutation in the BRCA2 gene. The patient is scheduled to begin chemotherapy and is advised to avoid pregnancy. Which of the following is the best contraceptive option for this patient?
In the case of a 2-year-old baby diagnosed with keratomalacia as shown in the image below, what is the prescribed dosage of vitamin A?

options.label: A
options.text: 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by same dose after 24 hours

options.label: B
options.text: 1,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 1 week

options.label: C
options.text: 1,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 24 hours and after a week

options.label: D
options.text: 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

questions.text: All of the following are true about theophylline except:
questions.correct_answer: B. Dectivation of histone deacetylase: Anti-inflammatory
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Dectivation of histone deacetylase: Anti-inflammatory

questions.text: A 28-year-old doctor working for Medicine sans frontiers is travelling to several countries of Africa. She is 12 weeks pregnant and visits for yellow fever vaccination which is mandatory for travel to some countries in Africa. As it’s a live vaccine, she is worried if it is safe for her. What will you advise?

options.label: C
options.text: Take the vaccine but avoid travel

questions.correct_answer: D. Take the vaccine and travel
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Take the vaccine and travel

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases where travel to yellow fever endemic areas is essential, the yellow fever vaccine can be safely administered during pregnancy as the benefits far outweigh the theoretical risks.
  • ➤ yellow fever endemic areas
  • ➤ yellow fever vaccine

questions.text: A 21-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department due to continuous vomiting, diarrhea, and high fever for a day. The patient also has a severe headache that is unrelieved by acetaminophen. The patient spent the last 3 months in Southeast Asia and returned yesterday on an international flight. She is currently on the fifth day of her menstrual period and has had to use both tampons and pads due to heavy bleeding. Temperature is 39.4 C (103 F), blood pressure is 80/40 mm Hg, and pulse is 124/min. Physical examination reveals a diaphoretic woman with dry mucous membranes. There is no nuchal rigidity. An erythematous macular rash covers the entire body, including the palms and soles. Which of the following microorganisms is most likely responsible for this patient's symptoms?

A 5-year-old child is brought to the Pediatrics OPD with eczematous rash over the skin. His past history reveals that he had recurrent skin infections and pneumonia in the past six months. Hemogram reveals low platelet count. Which of the following investigations should be done in this patient?
What is the average duration of lochia discharge in a puerperal woman?
What is the use of the instrument given below?

A 2-month-old boy is brought to the emergency department for evaluation of cyanosis. The infant has had similar episodes during feeding and crying, but these resolved quickly. On examination, the infant is ill-appearing, agitated, cyanotic, and tachypneic. Cardiac auscultation reveals a grade 2/6 crescendo-decrescendo systolic ejection murmur at the left upper sternal border and a single second heart sound. The patient is placed in a knee-chest position immediately. This maneuver improves the patient's condition predominantly by which of the following mechanisms?

A 4-year-old male presents with coarse facial features, enlarged liver and spleen, and a progressive decline in cognitive abilities. Urine analysis reveals the presence of glycosaminoglycans. Corneal clouding was absent. Which enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for the symptoms observed in this patient?

A 29-year-old woman with ulcerative colitis is brought to the emergency department after a syncopal episode while getting out of bed. Yesterday she developed right-sided abdominal pain which has spread across the lower abdomen over the past few hours. She also noticed a blood stain on her underwear after the syncopal episode. The patient was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis 3 years ago and is in remission with oral mesalamine therapy. Her last menstrual period was 8 weeks ago. The patient uses condoms intermittently for contraception. Her temperature is 37 C (98 F), blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg, and pulse is 125/min. She has diffuse lower abdominal pain with rebound tenderness and voluntary guarding. Pelvic examination shows cervical motion and right adnexal tenderness, no masses are palpated. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
Following delivery of a twin pregnancy which was unbooked, the placenta is examined and is as shown. What is the likely time of splitting of the embryo?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) After the 8thday

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In monozygotic twinning , the timing of embryo splitting determines whether twins will be dichorionic diamniotic (DCDA), monochorionic diamniotic (MCDA), monochorionic monoamniotic (MCMA), or conjoined twins . In MCMA pregnancies, the embryo splits after the 8th day , resulting in one placenta and one amniotic sac .
  • ➤ monozygotic twinning
  • ➤ dichorionic diamniotic (DCDA), monochorionic diamniotic (MCDA), monochorionic monoamniotic (MCMA),
  • ➤ conjoined twins
  • ➤ 8th day
  • ➤ one placenta
  • ➤ one amniotic sac

questions.text: Which of the following is not an indicator of fetal lung maturity?

options.label: D
options.text: Nile blue test showing >50% of blue cells

questions.correct_answer: D. Nile blue test showing >50% of blue cells
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Nile blue test showing >50% of blue cells

questions.text: A 6-year-old girl is brought to the OPD by her mother for evaluation of abdominal pain. The patient has had no fevers, diarrhea, or bloody stools. She first noticed an erythematous, macular rash over her daughter's legs and back 2 days ago that has become darker and more confluent today. The patient has a history of moderate persistent asthma for which she uses an inhaled fluticasone inhaler daily and albuterol as needed for wheezing. The right knee is mildly swollen and painful with passive range of motion. Which of the following glomerular abnormalities is most likely present in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Localized areas of mesangial sclerosis and collapse

options.label: B
options.text: The shortest distance between the sacral promontory and the symphysis pubis.

options.label: C
options.text: The distance from the lowest margin of the symphysis to the sacral promontory.

options.label: D
options.text: The distance from the posterior margin of the sacral promontory to the symphysis pubis.

questions.correct_answer: A. The distance from midpoint of sacral promontory to the upper most margin of the symphysis pubis.
questions.explanation: Ans. A. The distance from midpoint of sacral promontory to the upper most margin of t

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman, gravida 4 para 2 aborta 1, comes to the emergency department at 24 weeks gestation with vaginal bleeding that started after intercourse. The patient woke up in a pool of bright red blood and continues to soak through a pad every hour. She has not had routine prenatal care during this pregnancy but had a sonogram at 8 weeks gestation that showed a singleton intrauterine pregnancy. The patient has had 2 cesarean deliveries at term and a cervical conization earlier this year. She smokes a pack of cigarettes daily. Blood pressure is 124/78 mm Hg and pulse is 92/min. Fetal monitoring shows a baseline of 140/min, accelerations, absent decelerations, and moderate variability. On speculum examination, there are large clots in the vaginal vault, a closed cervix, and active bleeding from the os. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
Match the following developmental milestones:
As a senior resident in the OBG department, you would consider uterine artery embolization as a treatment option in all of the following cases except:

options.label: B
options.text: Prior to the removal of Placenta accreta in Multiparous woman

options.label: C
options.text: Patient diagnosed with calcified and pedunculated submucous fibroids

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient diagnosed with calcified and pedunculated submucous fibroids
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Patient diagnosed with calcified and pedunculated submucous fibroids

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman is evaluated at her 32nd week of pregnancy. Laboratory results are as follows: Arterial pH: 7.45 Paoz: 110 mm Hg PaCO2: 30 mm Hg Bicarbonate: 20 mEq/L Hemoglobin: 11 g/dL Blood urea nitrogen:5 mg/dL Creatinine: 0.6 mg/dL Which of the following best explains this patient's status?
A 24-year-old primi is in labor. The baseline FHR is 110bpm. All are possible causes for fetal bradycardia except?

A 29-year-old woman, gravida 2 para 1, at 38 weeks gestation comes to the emergency department due to severe abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. The patient had an ultrasound at 8 weeks gestation for vaginal spotting but has not otherwise received prenatal care this pregnancy. Her prior pregnancy two and a half years ago ended in a classical cesarean delivery at 24 weeks gestation for placental abruption. The patient smokes a pack of cigarettes daily and uses cocaine multiple times a week. Blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg and pulse is 130/min. The abdomen is tender and has an irregular mass; no contractions are palpated. Bright red blood is noted on the perineal pad. Fetal heart tracing shows multiple prolonged decelerations to 100/min. Which of the following risk factors most likely contributed to this patient's presentation?
Which of the following is seen in physiological jaundice?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

options.label: B
options.text: Increased indirect bilirubin, absent urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

options.label: C
options.text: Increased direct bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

options.label: D
options.text: Increased direct bilirubin, absent urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Increased indirect bilirubin, increased urobilinogen, absent bilirubin in urine

questions.text: Anti-D vaccine is not given in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following options is incorrectly matched?
A woman presented in her 8th week of pregnancy seeking MTP. The appropriate dosage of Misoprostol (administered by mucosal route) would be:

A 22-year-old woman comes to the clinic for a routine examination. She is a gymnast. Three months ago, she sustained a vulvar contusion during a competition but otherwise she has been healthy. The patient is sexually active with a male partner and uses an intrauterine device for contraception. She does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. Examination shows a mobile, soft, nontender, flesh-coloured, 2-cm cystic mass at the 4 o'clock position at the base of the left labium majus. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
What is the management of the lesion described in the last question?
Which of the following instruments are used in the caesarean section? Bard-Parker blade Doyen's retractor Cusco's speculum Allis forceps Shirodkar's uterine clamp Green Armytage forceps

A woman undergoes a radical hysterectomy with bilateral pelvic and para-aortic lymph node dissection for a 2-cm squamous cell carcinoma of the cervix". On final pathologic evaluation of the surgical specimen, the parametria are positive for cancer involvement. Based on these findings, which International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) clinical stage is she assigned?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) IB2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cervical cancer staging is determined clinically, with imaging modalities such as MRI or CT aiding the process. The findings of parametrium involvement on histopathology do not alter the clinical staging, which remains 1B2 for a 2 cm lesion confined to the cervix.
  • ➤ 1B2

questions.text: All of the following can be indicators of choriocarcinoma except:

options.label: A
options.text: Increased number of theca lutein cysts

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased number of theca lutein cysts
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Increased number of theca lutein cysts

questions.text: A 31-year-old woman, gravida 1 para 1, is seen in the hospital on postoperative day 2 due to lower abdominal pain, chills, and pain with sitting. She came to the hospital when she had no contractions a day after spontaneous rupture of membranes. After a 26-hour induction of labor, she had a primary cesarean delivery for arrest of descent. The breasts are full but have no erythema or fluctuant masses. The uterine fundus is firm and tender to palpation. There is scant serosanguineous drainage from the lower aspect of the incision. Pelvic examination shows a small amount of blood on the perineal pad with mildly foul-smelling discharge. Which of the following is the best regimen for treating this patient's condition?
The hormone that does not play a role in the growth of the fetus is:

A 25-year-old lady with submucosal fibroid was undergoing myomectomy. The surgeon was using 1.5% glycine as irrigating fluid for the cavity. During the surgery, the nurse informs that there is a 500ml deficit of the irrigating fluid. What is the next step to be done?

options.label: B
options.text: Change the fluid to normal saline

options.label: C
options.text: Continue the surgery with careful monitoring of fluid status

options.label: D
options.text: Give furosemide to the patient and continue surgery

questions.correct_answer: C. Continue the surgery with careful monitoring of fluid status
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Continue the surgery with careful monitoring of fluid status

questions.text: A patient is suspected of having an inherited disorder. Pedigree analysis shows the following pattern. This patient most likely has which of the following conditions?
In which of the following patients is a karyotype most likely needed?

options.label: B
options.text: 18-year-old with amenorrhea and an elevated prolactin level

options.label: C
options.text: 16-year-old with amenorrhea with normal secondary sexual characters and no mullerian structures on sonography

options.label: D
options.text: 16-year-old with amenorrhea with normal secondary sexual characters and uterus seen on imaging

questions.correct_answer: C. 16-year-old with amenorrhea with normal secondary sexual characters and no mullerian structures on sonography
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 16-year-old with amenorrhea with normal secondary sexual characters and no mullerian structures on sonography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A karyotype is necessary to differentiate between Mullerian agenesis (MRKH) and Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (AIS) in a patient with primary amenorrhea, normal secondary sexual characteristics, and absence of Mullerian structures. These conditions have different genetic backgrounds (46,XX for MRKH and 46,XY for AIS), which guides appropriate management.
  • ➤ karyotype
  • ➤ Mullerian agenesis (MRKH)
  • ➤ Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (AIS)

questions.text: A 32-year-old primigravida comes to the hospital at 28 weeks gestation due to painful contractions that began 2 hours ago and are currently occurring every 5 minutes. The patient reports frequent fetal movement and no leakage of fluid or vaginal bleeding. Her temperature is 37 C (98.7 F), blood pressure is 125/60 mm Hg, and pulse is 80/min. A digital examination shows the cervix is 3 cm dilated and 90% effaced with a bulging bag. An ultrasound confirms vertex presentation. The fetal heart rate tracing is normal and the tocometer shows uterine contractions every 5 minutes. Betamethasone and indomethacin are administered. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management of this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Observe and reexamine the cervix in 2 hours

questions.text: A 76-year-old female presented with a non-healing ulcer on the labia majora for a period of 6 months, measuring 2 cm x 3 cm. No lymph nodes were palpable. Biopsy shows squamous cell carcinoma. How do you manage this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Radical vulvectomy with unilateral LN dissection

options.label: B
options.text: Radical vulvectomy with bilateral LN dissection

questions.correct_answer: A. Radical vulvectomy with unilateral LN dissection
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Radical vulvectomy with unilateral LN dissection

questions.text: Which of the following increase the risk of recurrence of febrile seizures? Age <1 year Temperature of 38-39°C Duration of fever <24 h Duration of fever >48 h

A 35-year-old woman, gravida 1 para 0, at 20 weeks gestation comes to the office for a routine prenatal visit and fetal anatomy ultrasound. The ultrasound reveals several abnormalities. An amniocentesis is performed, and a fetal karyotype analysis is ordered; the results are shown in the image below: This fetus is at greatest risk for developing which of the following conditions after birth?
A 28-year-old nulligravida presents with primary amenorrhea. She is diagnosed with Swyer syndrome. During pelvic laparoscopy, what is the expected finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Streak gonads and male internal genitalia

options.label: B
options.text: Streak gonads and female internal genitalia

options.label: C
options.text: Empty pelvis (no gonads or internal genitalia)

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral abdominal testes and male internal genitalia

questions.correct_answer: B. Streak gonads and female internal genitalia

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy collapses suddenly while playing basketball with his friends. The boy played basketball every weekend without any symptoms and was in his usual state of health prior to this event. Family history is significant for a maternal uncle who died at age 25 for unknown reasons. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation is unsuccessful and the patient is pronounced dead. Post- mortem examination would most likely show which of the following?
Which of the following are causes of neonatal seizures? Hyponatremia Hypomagnesemia Hypocalcemia Hypernatremia

A 18-year-old girl with primary amenorrhea, no breast development and Prader 3 genitalia was found to have raised FSH. Her karyotype revealed 45 X0/46 XY and an ultrasound revealed Mullerian structures with poorly visualized gonads. What would be the next line of management?

A 49-year-old woman, gravida 5 para 5, comes to the OPD due to involuntary, intermittent loss of urine over the past 5 months. The patient is an avid jogger and now must wear absorbent pads while jogging. Three years ago, the patient was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus, which is treated with metformin. The patient loses a small amount of urine when asked to cough. Postvoid residual urine volume is 40 mL. Clean-catch urinalysis results are as follows: Blood: negative Glucose: negative Leukocyte esterase: negative Nitrites: negative White blood cells: 3-5/hpf Serum hemoglobin A1c is 7.7%. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
A 3-year-old child was brought to the OPD for a regular check-up. His growth chart shows his BMI between 85th and 95th percentile. Which of the following categories would you place him in?

A newborn girl is evaluated in the delivery room for respiratory distress. The patient was born 15 minutes ago by spontaneous vaginal delivery at 37 weeks gestation to a mother who received no prenatal care. Temperature is 37 C (98.6 F), pulse is 176/min, and respirations are 70/min. Pulse oximetry is 82% on room air. Physical examination shows grunting; subcostal and suprasternal retractions; and cyanosis of the lips and tongue. The chest appears rounded and the abdomen appears flat. Auscultation reveals absent breath sounds on the left and clear breath sounds on the right. Heart sounds are loudest in the right chest. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

A 13-year-old female presents with increasing abdominal pain. She has begun appropriate pubertal development, although menarche has not occurred. During examination, a central abdominopelvic mass is appreciated. The MR imaging results are shown. Which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely present?

options.label: D
options.text: Obstructed hemivagina and ipsilateral renal anomaly (OHVIRA) syndrome

questions.text: A preterm neonate, who was born via spontaneous vaginal delivery at 36 weeks gestation, did not cry at birth. Despite positive pressure ventilation (PPV) and intubation, the child did not improve. Therefore, chest compressions were initiated. What is the criterion for initiating chest compressions?

A 34-year-old woman is referred to the gyn OPD with an incidental finding of b/l solid ovarian masses on an ultrasound. She is a known case of breast cancer treated a few years back. A biopsy of the masses shows the following image. What is your diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Krukenberg tumor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A Krukenberg tumor is a metastatic ovarian tumor that most commonly arises from the stomach and is histologically characterized by signet ring cells . It is often bilateral and may also arise from breast cancer metastases.
  • ➤ signet ring cells

questions.text: A 4-day-old, full-term boy is brought to the office for his first visit after an uncomplicated vaginal delivery and unremarkable newborn nursery course. The patient's mother, gravida 1 para 1, has blood type A positive, and prenatal laboratory results and ultrasound were normal. Birth weight was 3.4 kg and length was 48.5 cm. He has been exclusively breastfed since birth and nurses for 10 minutes on each breast every 4 hours. He has 2 wet diapers each day but has not voided today. He has scleral icterus and jaundice of the face, chest, and abdomen. Laboratory results are as follows: Total bilirubin 14 mg/dL Direct bilirubin 0.9 mg/dL Which of the following is the most likely cause of this infant's hyperbilirubinemia?
